title: How Norman Hartnell changed royal fashion forever
text:
Few couturiers can be more aligned with the British Royal family than Sir Norman Hartnell. From his atelier at 26 Bruton Street, the designer outfitted four generations of royals in full-skirted evening gowns and state visit suits.

Yet despite his achievements – Queen Elizabeth’s wedding gown and coronation gown and robes among them – Hartnell is often viewed as a tradition-bound fogey. A new display of his work at the Fashion and Textile Museum seeks to shake the mothballs from his reputation and make a case for his legacy as a fashion innovator.

“Hartnell brought back a sense of romance in fashion,” says Michael Pick, curator of the display and author of a forthcoming biography of the designer....
